fJJi_sHUgGH3m5dEEnVGbw.text: Quick attentive bartenders. No Convenient parking. No Patrons above the age of 24. No Hot waitresses. No. Slow Waitresses. Yes. Everlasting brodeo. Yes. Dirty Bathrooms. Yes. Douchebaggery all around. Yes. Unfresh oysters. Yes.  $3 kiltlifter. Yes. Asshole cops that follow you home afterwards. Yes.  I decided that I pretty much hate this place. Sorry, I just do.

5ZE9e1qxHNnhFV-0m2eSBw.text: Good neighborhood bar. Great patio, laid back atmosphere. Males, don't miss the blarney stone, just don't kiss it!

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Patio guest

jWemrks9hSNhKUywVOp8cQ.text: This place really doesn't need another review, but seeing how it's my home away from home, I feel obliged to speak up from the peanut gallery.  I adore this joint as both a bar and a restaurant. It has the best patio in all of Tempe, nay all of Phoenix, no--history. Alright, probably not history. I mean, if there were a bar in the middle of some wicked beautiful natural reserve, I'm sure it would trump Casey's. But I'm not qualifying their worth based on beauty. (Sorry, dearest. I'll make sure to spend freely this weekend to make up for that slight.) The five stars it gets is based on the general relaxing vibe it exudes.  It's far enough off the Mill Avenue strip that the douchebaggery of those bars rarely flows over into Casey's. I've seen that the only gripe most people have with this bar is the occasional frat boy that wanders onto the patio, but even though these specimens in their natural environment are prone to swinging their dicks and strutting with impunity, they act different once they're surrounded by the regular clientele. The regulars could care less that you're the beer pong champion or top sorority sex kitten, can you engage in a meaningful conversation? No? Then kindly take your bulging biceps and stilettos to Scottsdale, where you're sure to be appreciated.  I love the fact that this bar attracts such a broad range of people, all of whom coexist in an atmosphere of mutual respect and happy drunkenness. The elderly come here for the oysters, the hipsters come here to show off their newest tattoo. ASU professors coexist with high school dropouts. Professional bar hoppers chit chat with weekend warriors. The food's pretty wicked as well.   French onion soup, the Hippie Sandwich, the Tuna Bacon Melt, the Fishwich (without bread it just becomes fish and chips, but way cheaper), the Oysters Rockefeller, the Chipotle Chicken Wings, the Clamstrip basket at 5 bucks a pop...it's greasy and divine. The prices aren't absurd, but are a little on the steep side for bar food, but it's totally worth it. And if you go for happy hour, there are free munchies inside near the dart board.  It's a lovely little pub with a great patio, friendly servers and decent drink prices. Go there often enough and I'm sure its subtle charm will capture your fancy (and your wallet), just as it has countless others.  Dearest Casey Moore, you hold a place in my heart and although my liver denies it, she thinks you're pretty cool too.

qgaUOTeseYyZw4qI0gaHcA.text: First five star rating. Everything was perfect. Ordered three appetizers for my girlfriend and myself along with a few drinks. Got a seafood combo which consisted of shrimp, oysters, and tuna. Really yum. Ordered the lobster cakes which were good but who can mess up lobster cakes? Last but not least, by far the best oysters I have ever tasted, the "Rockefellers". The name exceeds its quality. Unreal. The waiter warned me it would be a 45 minute wait for the oysters to be steamed and baked and the result was astoundingly impressive. Seemed as if I was tasting oysters combined with a cheese pizza. Good stuff! I will be going back.

25r5IhdtaQwweZXwvhDTMg.text: Casey Moore oh how I love thee.   You helped me through college even more than all my classes and prof's combined.     You taught me that day drinking was an acceptable practice.     You taught me on many a nights that drinking and biking don't mix.  You even clean up nice enough that I brought my family and grandma here for dinner once.     Happy hours with co-workers you're into that too.  First date, yup, you're on it.  Thanks Casey!

WJF0WH-b9KcZ2Q0G9lrzzw.text: I've ventured down to Tempe to hit Casey Moore's a few times now, with the first time happening at the suggestion of a couple friends who went to ASU and thought that I, who was busy last spring cursing  and shaking my fist at Phoenix, would like this place.   And I did. Quite a bit, actually. And quite a surprise.  I thought at the time that any drinking venue near ASU would be all the same - meatmarket bars full of interchangeable guys with too much gel in their hair and interchangeable girls with too much boob under their, uh, boobs.   But Casey's was chill. Sure, I was older than everyone else probably by a decade or more, but it didn't matter. Everyone was hanging out at tables in the massive patio just enjoying time with their friends. No Usher's"Yeah" blasting out of the speakers for the 5 billionth time. No girl spilling her fifth cosmo. No posers.  Just real people.   And Guinness.  Can't forget the Guiness.  5 stars for keeping it real.

1umqTK-hlpjs3LWhjV-I1A.text: Pretty average establishment and one of the few places undeserving of its 4/5 Yelp rating in my opinion.  The place is average in terms of size and accomodations.  It has a frustratingly small parking lot.  The service is slow and the staff is generally pretty obnoxious.  The food ranges from typical bar fare to a  couple upscale dishes.  The deal breaker here is the atmosphere.  I see reviews stating that it's a "great laid-back place to go hang out".  I'm not sure what bar they were talking about, but it isn't Casey Moore's.  This is the type of place people go to be seen.  Most of the patrons on the weekends look like they fell out of an Urban Outfitters ad.  These are the type of people that spend three hours in front of the mirror perfecting their "just threw this outfit on" look.  Yes indie kids, I'm talking to you: Don't worry, they serve PBR here.  I know you'll lose your superhero powers of "listening to music no one's ever heard of" if you don't consume at least one Pabst a day.   If you're determined to go, go on a weekday and avoid the hipsters.   People send friends ahead to camp out tables for entire weekend evenings, so good luck finding a place to sit.  Otherwise, just head a few blocks away to Four Peaks.

9pC3FjzomotKmd_SsOW1rQ.text: Casual, laid-back, perfection of a bar. Huge, fresh oysters on the half shell, bubbly or beer or spirits, patio dining all year with great music, dogs and kids ok. This place has character and yummy beer, and shell fish to boot. Not a fancy restaurant, but more an authentic neighborhood hippy rest-stop. The good kind of hippy. With optional champagne. Music ventured from depeche mode to instrumentals by the cure to island songs. This place is everything good. Skip the clam strips (chewy), and escargot (cream sauce); go for the oysters (fresh huge) and zucchini (lightly battered and awesome). And the cheap, fresh beer and atmosphere. This is a happy place.

iuxiOj6XPYoQL9vwadt_UQ.text: Came here for the first time on Sunday afternoon, and loved it.  Ordered strictly off the appetizer menu so we could try oysters, clam strips, hummus, and crab cakes - and all four were amazing.  Best crab cakes I've ever had.  Nice beer selection, good mixed drinks.  Also enjoyed the layed-back patio setting.  People brought their dogs.  Nice casual atmosphere with friendly servers.  Can't wait to go back!

ClXfHFfoPpw-wXqDJFnQ6w.text: Great place for a laid back , casual dinner. We ate on the patio under one of the heat lamps, which made the temperature perfectly delightful for early Spring. We started w/some raw oysters and fried zucchini. The portions and presentation were very nice. Then we split the grilled shrimp & salmon, linguini alfredo. Everything was really good. I ordered a tall, 7&7 and it was strong and a nice size. Our server was polite and informative. If you are looking for tasty food, a laid back environment and some good people watching, then we highly recommend!

U81rltQnKkqW-_wF9l8awQ.text: Casey's is probably the bar I've been to the most since I've lived in the Valley, and although its seen me through many phases of growth along my twenties and in the full spectrum of sobriety, it has remained so reassuringly consistent.  I started coming here while still in grad school at ASU in 2000 and I was hooked by the best patio in the Valley and the eclectic mix of people indie, students, yups (.... the sportos, the motorheads, geeks, sluts, bloods, waistoids, dweebies, dickheads  ... okay, that last part was from Ferris Beuller).    There is no better mesh of drinkers in the valley than you will find at Casey's.  Its a comfortable place for everyone to come and drink.  Heck, i even had my after-graduation reception here with a bunch of family and out-of-towners who really enjoyed the atmosphere, drinks and food as well.  Its a place to come for day drinking, happy hour, special events (St Paddy's), early evening, pre-concert, late night, and last call. Its good to take your date or your best friend or even the fam.  If you like beer, its your spot, if you like the hard stuff, its your spot.  It is truly "the perfect bar".  Oh, and you can always count on this place being "alive" because something that really fucks me up about the Valley are the lack of people drinking in bars I'm at ... and that kind of atmosphere tends to suck all the life out of the evening.

8SwDxMkJ0Of9yeNAnrgQ4Q.text: My sister & I went there for a ghost hunting venture (the place is suppose to be haunted). We didn't experience anything paranormal, but really did enjoy lunch there after.

v6Q767ByK3QHsPFLrhLSmA.text: The atmosphere here is a very large social gathering and seems to be a great place for the alternative crowd from mill and college kids. The bartenders are pretty fast and spot on. the prices are average. The food is pretty good, and not too expensive. It's a great place to go to spend an evening with friends or to meet new people. It can get pretty busy and the parking lot is not very big so sometimes you have to walk a little bit, but usually not much.

w17PknnMFtUAisE62sBLgA.text: Not an oyster man myself, but a great hangout and great place to grab a drink. I loved their mozzarella sticks. But then again I'm a sucker for mozzarella sticks.

hqi8vNNX4JoQ2IRfzfSnYA.text: Everybody raves about this place.   But, come on...the food is not that great-  over-priced greasy bar food.  And the crowd-please it's horrible. Just because a lot of people go there doesn't make it amazing.   The only pro is it is a great place for big groups and it has a pretty nice patio.   But, its impossible to get a table.

nKQBvpVHfFAh_hmSfTtfwQ.text: Atmosphere here is perfect. We sit outside all the time, scoop out a spot by the heater, since it's usually night when we get there. They have beer specials late night which in my book is perfect.  I was here yet again with some amazing people the other night... we're that table that never stops laughing and is always having a good tme.  The food... ok so I've only eaten the food here once, and I ordered the fish & chips... it says best in town. Not the greatest tasting food ever I was incredibly hungry and ate most my fish, and all the cole slaw. I must admit I am a used to really amazing fish & chips moving to AZ from San Francisco and always being in Malibu. But considering I'm now in the middle of the desert they were pretty legit.  I would say go here and drink your night away. I love people watching here and sitting outside in the trees I feel like I'm in  a secret spot where you could possibly see a unicorn.

F4r2hvmsEe8SvTLwq5d8fg.text: I've been here once, and I will only go here once. I met my husband and some friends there after work sometime in February, when it was still cold enough at night to require jackets and outdoor heaters to sit outside. We were seated in a dark corner of the patio, where there were THREE portable heaters, none of which were turned on. We asked our ditzy, busty, DUMB waitress FOUR TIMES to turn them on, and she kept saying, "I'll have to ask someone to do it. I don't know how."  I finally asked her WHO she had to ask, and she pointed to the dirty looking guys acting as bouncers at the gate, who apparently are the only ones in the joint authorized to turn on the heat lamps. Fine. I walked over to them and asked if we could get our heaters turned on, and the guy walked right over and did it for us. Took all of 30 seconds.   Oh, and it took about 45 minutes for our food to arrive, and when it did, several of the orders were messed up. And the waitress didn't care. And it wasn't that good.   Can you tell I didn't really care for this place (note my frequent use of all-caps)? And yet it will continue on, because college students will continue to buy their beer and flaccid fries as long as ASU is there.  Ah well. We can't all have as refined taste as I.  OK, as long as I'm in pretentious snob mode, I'd like to point out that one of the reviews of this establishment excuses the small oyster portions because "we're in a dessert." Um...stripper jumping out of a cake? Or do you really not know how to spell DESERT?  Yowza. I'm usually nicer.

rsfct3lMCI1WHT2rGcbZAA.text: This place is just so cool.  The space is amazing - an indoor/outdoor, sprawling quarter block that includes various rooms in a converted bungalow, plus lots of outdoor decks, nooks, and crannies. The crowd is varied and chill - not a frat boy in sight for miles. Heat lamps, twinkly lights, booths, tables, and benches; something for everyone.  They're often crazy busy and should have more waitstaff to keep things moving at times. Plus the menu is totally standard and unremarkable barfare served reasonably cheap. If you're interested in fast as lightning service at all times and an adventurous menu full of organic locally grown ingredients, RUN! But if you want to hang out with your friends under the stars and over a beer for hours on end in the coolest space ever, this is heaven.

q-vNiRhLCj_YWSy1ryR49w.text: Went on a week day for dinner. Service was so so and so was the food. Nothing to really brag about. Place is old and had a funky smell when you walk inside. I would say this is more a local watering hole then a restaurant.  There are better places to go then here for Oysters and other food.

e3E_OyDjgZc41EW2OslC3w.text: I finally went here, after reading the reviews and pouting about how busy I was with work and how it is hard to find someone to be my Designated Driver, since Arizona is way more strict than NJ when it comes to people drinking and driving.    So, I finally arrived at Casey Moore's last night and was impressed.  This is an upgraded Irish pub/bar with a great beer selection, yummy yummy yummy crab cakes, and a cozy atmosphere.    It was Thursday night in which they have a special on Kiltlifter (sp?) and I was pretty excited.  The music was not that good.  I wish that they would have a DJ there on busy THursday nights.  That would really enhance the atmosphere and probably their people traffic as well.  I vote for a DJ on Thursday nights, heck, I have amazing music, I could just be the DJ.  I will be back very soon to try their oysters and some of the other seafood dishes and of course more beer on tap.  Seriously, you need a DJ on Thursday nights.

n9UICPyt8kLJptHFLYtWBw.text: I have been to Casey moore's and I usually love the food and service but yesterday I had a horrible experience. Our waiter didn't ask us what we wanted to drink and just brought out cups and a pitcher of water.. He didn't even pour the water for us. Next, he ignored us and sat down watching the game. We ordered an appetizer that never came out and 30 minutes later when we got our meals I asked him about the fried pickles and he apparently never put the order in because we didn't get them until after we were all done eating and he didn't even comp them. Then there was a hair in my friends sandwich, we finally got his attention to get her a new one and he seemed annoyed at us and didn't even apologize. He made us pay for everything and when we signed our books he hovered over us to grab them when we were done, which you're not supposed to do as a server ever. In general, I would give this place 4 stars but yesterday I give it 1.

0bkPuAQiVoz0Njpc2V30AA.text: Taking everything into consideration, Casey Moore's is a five star experience. With an unbeatable patio, equipped with an awesome koi pond, unique lighting, eclectic decor and a water feature for men to relieve themselves on (discrete of course). It's truly unlike anything in the area, or the state for that matter. Supposedly haunted, the restaurant offers a unique feel with its hipster clientele and personality filled staff. You have not seen Tempe if you have not been to Casey Moore's.

BsvYHxtOAJOUX97wRE9P4w.text: Great flavor, fresh oysters, good beer, cool vibe, and amazing service. Can't go wrong with this place!

Bx_dYapzpuomuKQy_ya_lQ.text: I gave 4 stars as I don't want to hurt current rating I may not rely on yelp as much as it was the reviews that brought us here, bottom line we are over 50 couple looking for a dinner place, this is not it, I would suggest if you are over 30, go elsewhere, we decided not to even sit down to eat, clearly target younger crowd

xvdj5Z5UVjVTbvKP1e8knw.text: Nice patio, relaxed feel, good beer selection the only thing they need to add a little kicker too is the food. Not the best oysters out there but you never know could have just been a bad batch. The customer service and  atmosphere is what will make me come back

56ZG9d10lNhDlMDWxaew-Q.text: I feel like I'm writing several negative reviews, but maybe I was just unlucky with my choices?  Drinks - I had a nice white wine I cannot remember the name of, but it did the job. Food - I had maybe two bites due to chatting with my pals, but ended up leaving the leftovers on the table since it didn't really do much for me. Maybe I order poorly, but my pasta was lame. Service - Waitress with an attitude and waiter that walked around with an aloof expression on his face. Neither were very attentive to our group of 13+. Ambiance - I'm confused... We're in Tempe... a land-locked state, correct? Oysters? At an Irish pub? Really? Like I said, confusing!

O3fAj8P-VYJZVh2HHBOzrg.text: Great spot to grab burgers and beers. The burgers always come out perfect, and the bartender is always friendly and quick to serve.  I wish I lived closer, that is my only complaint!

jvUhJTxD4I_NJk1hTifM-w.text: I like the tuna melt also with the crab meat in it. Also the bloody mary was really good. I like the fun atmosphere what is a great place to eat and the prices are not too bad

gOv8iQhba-DGfuDF5oIJEA.text: The food here is pretty good. I enjoy drinking outside.  A lot of hipsters hang out here.   Get over it. It's Tempe

ANVDGRJOQB8vze_0JnOPVg.text: I love this place, the service at the bar is always amazing and no matter what day it is there's always people buzzing around! I had some disappointing crab cakes that put a bad taste in my mouth, even though they say homemade I tasted something that was caught in a aqua duct. On the plus side I love the calamari rings and LOVE THE OYSTER ROCKEFELLER, great group fun, and soooo fresh! I've done lunch here and I had the meatloaf that was on spec that day and was in love, the flavor and complementing mash potatoes and veggies were a perfect match and I'm glad I listened to my bartender. I couldn't decide because I was hungover and this meatloaf and a Harp did the trick. Hippie sandwich is also on the top of my list and will always be my go-to meal at Casey Moore's.        Patios are open and have enough room for a larger group to meet and outdoor bar that is always open during the night, serious door people though, so don't forget your ID. I hear there's live music sometimes but I have never been. Great surrounding area, great local shops and walking distance to Mill Ave.

RQKsFHzH3zhVjP7wLo6ckA.text: How can you go wrong with Casey Moore's,  This chill location is like no other, located in the middle of a residential district Caseys offers a chill location compared to the busy Mill Ave.  The wait staff and patrons are great peoples that come to enjoy a good beer and their friends.  Be ready to enjoy a very diverse crowed of people here.    The food, Ok well the food is above average here, personally I like the fries and the sandwich, I won't boast about every item on the menu.   Look for the lights on the tree when you driving down Ash.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States

mvclG0qFffYqRpgoLQu9wg.text: Casey's is forgiving and she gets 5 stars. I've been going there for ten years and even though I have been kicked out multiple times.. (Using the blarney stone, using the mens restroom, generally causing a rukus).. They always let me back in. (Sometimes with a stern warning to behave..) Their food is decent and inside dining suitable for family. I truly love this place, she is like my home away from home.

U-6j-HzYrubyoRtOIOm2-g.text: Love this place. Been going here for years. Great ambiance and customer service. So unique and laid back. Potato skins are my fave. See ya soon Caseys!!

EaZPwbvGdDI6PPJJzV7qWw.text: I know, a ton of reviews of this place but i find it interesting that people either seem to love it or really just don't get it. It sort of reminds me of when pulp fiction came out and you either thought it was a masterpiece (I did) or just didn't get it. So maybe Casey Moore's is the dining equivalent of pulp fiction. It certainly has that sort of gritty feel to it. However, after my last lunch review I have found myself going back for lunch several times and even for a nosh on an early Sunday evening and...it is all good. On Sunday my friend ordered the curry chicken soup and it was like...wow, everything you would expect out of a curry soup and perfect with a nice salad. At lunch the service continues to be good and the food not only reasonable but it continues to taste great.  Now, I do understand that it has a bit of a different ambiance when it is busier but that that has a certain charm as well though when I really want to enjoy a good beer I find myself wondering over to Taste of Tops to experience one of their ever changing micro-brews. However, for a nice lunch in a dark bar, or hanging out at a happy hour at the end of a week with some friends, it is great for that as well.  As for the four stars..I will admit, service can be a bit slow but people...learn to catch the eye of your server! Consider it a wonderful opportunity for some training in dining assertiveness and then just enjoy the vibe.

WVRa8h5H2kPww2cqpCfsmQ.text: This place is my absolute favorite! I recently moved to Phoenix and someone recommended this place to me. I immediately wanted to check it out and now it's my go-to spot. The crowd and staff are extremely friendly and inviting. They have a full bar and beer on tab for everyones palate. The food also tastes very fresh, including everything from the seafood to sandwiches and burgers. This place also has a huge outdoor patio, which I enjoy before all of the smokers congregate.  You'll probably find me there most weekends. Cheers!

tA3s3ZVMJRb8l87pv35aWw.text: Cheap drinks, good food and good atmosphere, but the service here is always just bad. Our waitress/waiters are usually short, unaccommodating and sometimes just plain rude. They'll disappear forever, making it difficult to order or get the check. On several occasions we've had to get up and wander around looking for our server. We keep coming back, so go for the first three things and don't expect much from the service.

ZNk0LqKR2GDIzO2h0owvaQ.text: Not sure how this place has four stars but it can't be for the food.  Had a dozen oysters and they just were not up to par.  Also the potato skins were just covered in cheese nothing much else.  The Reuben sandwich was pretty good so I gave them 3 stars cause the server was nice and attentive. I won't go back for the food.

uk6mBZu0mKKpOG7OyVOgKw.text: I LOVE Casey Moore's. I have been there several times and I have always found something I like. Their seafood is to die for, which is saying something for Arizona! I love their french dip sandwich as well.

y7qhaNL_ONlzN-retAGGVg.text: I was invited to this Irish pub for a group gathering and was pleasantly surprised by their menu full of seafood items. The interior included an enclosed outdoor patio full of ]tables and benches followed by a smaller dining interior. The atmosphere on that evening was hipsterish, very chill, with a college crowd at every turn.  It was a nice place for people watching and to spend time with friends.   I had the Blue Point Oysters ($7/half dozen) and the oysters were fresh, tasty, and meatier than those at Crab Factory. I can eat these all day long. Highly recommend it.  The Grilled Salmon ($19) came with a good size salmon and a mix of sauteed vegetables. The salmon was blackened without the skin, on the dry side, and the mix of sauteed veggies needed salt and seasoning. This dish was too bland for my preference, I won't be ordering this again.  I also had the opportunity sample their appetizers and particularly enjoyed the Deep Fried Mushrooms and Zucchini ($8) and Mozzarella Sticks ($6). They were fried to perfection, addictive, and good for sharing.   Service was limited to ordering, bringing food to our table, and bringing the check. Parking is plentiful for a location so close to campus. I hope to come back for the oysters and items such as the Steamed Clams and Shrimp Cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States

vaiTrH89Gpb16aCgozFZ0w.text: Great fried oysters! If you are an oyster fan I definitely suggest giving this place a shot but keep in mind it is supposed to be haunted.  Make sure you visit if your are in Tempe.

7nmv6dx1A3bENIVGSIH1fQ.text: We went here because it's advertised as an oyster bar, yet were told they were out of oysters. Really?? An oyster bar out of oysters? We ordered off the menu. Mediocre at best. Service was fairly slow. The place was pretty well packed for a Sunday night. It must be a popular spot for the AZ State students and a favorite watering hole for the locals. We weren't impressed.

ZLk6zrXMbRCXa3VK7rKgLA.text: Been here many of times before and love this place. But tonight was the worse ever! The waitress was the worse!!!!!!!!! She just threw silver ware to the side of our table, she forgot our wings, then me and another person in my group finished our beers and the waitress came up and took them and never asked if we wanted another one. It took forever to get anything from here (food and drinks and bills). When got the bill it was just the total written on a piece of paper with nothing else on their (it totaled out to $69) so asked her to re do the check with write out, which agian was just hand written but then the bill total was $67. This was the worse experience from a waitress ever!! The waitress name was Alex.

FoEosV3uJRIKfUnMgYIbmw.text: I came back a second time for happy hour with friends and can honestly say that I had an awesome experience this time around. We ordered oyster shooters without quite realizing what they were; they definitely aren't for the faint of heart! Peppered vodka, horseradish, cocktail sauce, and two oysters all served in an 8 ounce cup. I actually enjoyed it, but I can't say the same for one of the girls who took it.  I got the Oysters Rockefeller this time around and they were amazing! I stole a couple raw oysters from my friends too, and walked away thoroughly impressed. Extra points for having Smithwicks on tap.

fPsB9C1eybeLJ3BRSLhaOA.text: If you can't stand hipsters, don't go here. Otherwise, it's got a nice vibe at night and has a pretty decent selection for non domestic beers. I remember thinking the beer cost more than it should have, though! I can't speak to what the food is like--only came here for drinks one night with one of my girlfriends.   I probably won't come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States

0F5gcMmvjz2cTS7BifJEqQ.text: Maybe it's unfair to rate these guys, since I technically didn't eat there. What I did do was look up dog friendly restaurants, drive out to the place with my dog, then get told at the door that dogs aren't allowed after five.  I don't have the slightest idea what reason there could be for a dog curfew, (do dogs magically become a greater liability after five?) but every place I've ever been that claimed online to allow dogs, actually allows dogs during business hours. For this restaurant to advertise as dog friendly is a half truth. And in a state where it's literally illegal to leave your dog in a hot car, it's an immense inconvenience to get there and have nothing to do but turn around, go home, and order Chinese.

4wnEgd_DZFW5gGx5oZedmw.text: The first time I ever went to Casey's I was an infant, probably a week or 2 old. My dad took me to HIS favorite bar/restaurant to met his brother. Now, 25 years later, I go at least 2 or 3 times a week, either alone, with friend or on a date. I have a lot of friends in the area and I always run into someone I know. The giant patio has great shade in the daytime and is perfect for meeting with large groups (there are some tables that can hold 8 people). I have made friends with a couple servers because they are just awesome people, and I always have great service here. The oysters are really delicious and the food is pretty good for bar food, but a lot of it is fried so its not really healthy. The best part? Even though it is SUPER close to mill ave and ASU it never seems to get to that out-of-hand, party atmosphere but maintains the neighborhood feel with a great mix of people.

RjuhUVJMuxZZrFtTUqjxNA.text: So we walk in and I go to the restroom and my wife ends talking to this drunk at the bar who is wearing a pirate hat and the next thing you know we are being asked to leave before we have been even seated or served. Management says bartender made a "judgement call" . How do you make a judgement call when I haven't even been seated??? Food good. Management sucks. Skip this place and spend your hard earned bucks somewhere else.

kTBgSLqvUcNM_cvzXxRyuQ.text: This was my weekly spot when I was an ASU student back in the day. Hidden away in a quiet neighborhood this location has a lot to offer: drink specials, great food and most importantly--one heck of an atmosphere. Not a whole lot has changed since my last visit years ago and I'm glad it's sticking to its roots. As usual I ordered a blue moon and calamari. My fiancee ordered the dozen wings layered in teriyaki. The place is known for being an oyster house, and although I didn't order them this time they are too good to pass up on. Whenever I come back to Tempe I'll be sure to continue giving my business to Casey Moores.

M_qqWUXBf0IEABxj0q7rpg.text: The heart of Tempe. If a dive bar were good, this would be it. Good beer and food for a night out.

vuQFgQGvjjSC5oN0hTk58Q.text: What can I say...just go...sit outside, sip a drink have some oysters. It's pretty great

Gf7rLEdsl8YsCiZI-Hvu8g.text: This place is a Tempe GEM. Go here. Get the fried oysters with bacon & drink an Irish car bomb. You're welcome.

RZHbo_pzS3a8ZMIJJa3u5Q.text: Always been a favorite bar for my boyfriend & I . The vibe here is what I really look for in a bar- easy, no problems. The patio that wraps around the whole old house is really neat & really cool pond.  Cold beer & oysters is what I come in for- every time great. Bartenders are really nice & chill . They are attentive & hold good polite convos.   Only think that bummers me out is I am not closer to the location !

1gsq0TFGZ3mLoBvOre_-XQ.text: Oysters weren't bad for being in Arizona, but definitely not East coast good.  I had 18.  House salad I'd pass on in the future.  Cup of French onion soup was delicious.

Qfi24IT6XlqvbXCDSjvZDA.text: This place had better seafood than I've had in a long time. Great service, great food, great prices. I wouldn't recommend the marina sauce for the pasta, but I'm dairy free so it was just an unfortunate menu choice. The fish tacos were the hit of the night! We'll definitely be coming back.

67JzEapEnJih10NW2O7gJw.text: This I nice little hidden spot. Mainly where a lot of locals do go. The food is okay and the drinks are good. Very strong. However it's really the atmosphere and people that make it a good hang out spot

tsOpcAj6tcgZbMS9M3RqWQ.text: BOMB. Super cheap. Cool rock music with rocker vibes. Definitely would go again for the oysters and potatoes.

yfaO0265JWIekM0JRee4Iw.text: Staff not so friendly, food was okay. I would stick to the oysters Rockefeller or the wings. Nothing else on the menu really was exciting that we ordered. My friend had the taco salad and was not pleased.

jV1KDYqoY58IOIiDwglTjQ.text: Great food! I love their calamari, fish tacos and pasta dishes. I've not been disappointed yet.

hj9ikVAz7XRzbFAOz9xO4A.text: This was only my second visit to Casey Moore's even though I have lived in Tempe for 17 years. Crazy!  A few of us met on a Sunday morning. It was a bit chilly and sunny so we opted for outdoor seating. The team there quickly lit TWO heaters to help keep us warm. Some ordered food but I only ordered drinks only. I had two Bloody Marys and probably should have only had one. It was pretty strong. The first one was spicy and had a good kick. I ordered a second but asked for one not as spicy. It was equally as good.   We din't feel rushed even though were were there a couple of hours. Service was great and I hardly noticed that my check was delivered, picked up, and put back down for my signature without my noticing. In my mind this equates to superior service. Servers are unobtrusive and professional.   The only downfall is the outdoor smoking. Smokers can smoke anywhere outdoors so if you're there, you are apt to get whiffs of smoke as you dine. Not much of an issue for me but it could be for your companions. Just take note.   I plan to go back and try some of the yummy appetizers that my friends enjoyed. Bring on the calamari!

nIpDqJ-8M6o9xYT1os6QYw.text: I came here because I was visiting Tempe from California, I thought the food was about a 3 star, my friends and I got 2 dozens of oysters, 2 dishes of escargo, potato skins, crab cakes, and others.  I dropped the star to 1 because that they did the math wrong and overcharged my party by $36~ dollars,  I am going to send a receipt here to show proof of the math.    The total was about 116 for the food total, but they charged me 152 instead.  The only time had I ever had this experience.  If they contact me to fix this, then I'll reconsider the star rating.  -Randy

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Miscalculation for food total.

jhpBMun_4Xqx6L4Nn9zO8w.text: I've come to Casey's many times, and every time is a great experience. The appetizers, the wings, the burgers - it's all good. This was my first time going with my fiance on a date night, and I tried the chicken pesto pasta and sun dried tomatoes and I am SO FULL now! The atmosphere is always lax and comfortable, like you're hanging out on a neighbor's patio (if you're outside). I'm happy to have found a place that makes me feel so at home and serves me all the comfort food I love.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Pesto Pasta &amp; Sun Dried Tomato

tlkGOnc3L7bns4YEKGskBA.text: Casey Moore's Oyster House was so fun for a Wednesday afternoon. Service was fast and she put our order in a few minutes early for happy hour so we could start eating.  It was a quietish time of day we picked so it was awesome not to have all the drinkers there just yet.  We order naked hot wings with sauce on the side and I loved the flavor of the chipotle with ranch. Definitely not just a pub, the food delivers!  We ordered 2 dozen oysters and finished all of them easily! Great flavor and best price in AZ... seriously!

xO3cS3V3yWjtztAeM9eqEw.text: Mediocre food and exceptionally slow service.  The decor and bar are kinda cool and so is the patio, but wouldn't be back. Not worth the wait.

-0_o8W5e-ZyMFjFuRgwv1A.text: Spot has a cool scenery. Oysters were decent, definitely not the best. Service was ok. Best part of this visit was seeing the cute stray cats.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Scenery was cool. Lots of birds and some stray cats
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. 1/2 dozen oysters. Did not label what kind of oysters and I didnt care to find out based on taste.

EjmlSGVTWUWo-d4Q7SfdeQ.text: This is an old school type of bar in what appears to be a converted house. The ceilings are low and the rooms are dark. There are small seating areas inside. Outside there is more seating, but the weather can make that unusable.  The prices are good. The staff is nice. You feel comfortable and relaxed. I would not come here often if I lived in the area, but from time to time it would make for a fun afternoon.  There are some televisions so you can catch a game while enjoying a few drinks with friends. There is parking on two sides of the building.  We did not eat here. The menu is what you would expect from a bar or pub. Plenty of options for a casual meal or appetizers with friends.

WBJg5czVE_XG5cDkjaLHsw.text: For us, this turned out to be a "come for the seafood, stay for the ______" situation.  It seemed counter intuitive to come all the way to Tempe for seafood but it sounded good so we came.  This was a REALLY cool place...somewhere I'd probably really like to be all the time. I don't know what it looks like in the morning but at night, with the lights and trees, it was enchanting. Just picture a warm, balmy evening, sipping on a beer with a date or, really anyone.  The challenge is not to fall in love right then and there.  Everyone was really nice and friendly.  We spotted a few servers (including ours) sitting down with patrons but service didn't suffer.  We were given the space we needed to relax and enjoy ourselves and the food came out in a timely fashion.  The fresh oysters hit the spot except they didn't detach the muscle holding the oyster to the shell.  We figure that out pretty quickly when we slurped a mouthful of air/cocktail sauce on our first round, the bivalve itself still stuck to the shell, sans sauce.  The clam chowder was too thick for my taste, and husband commented too floury.  There was a good amount of clam chunks in it, though.  Escargot...I get this dish everywhere I go.  Unfortunately, the snails that night were gamey.  REALLY gamey.  The sauce was fantastic but I couldn't get on board with the snails.  I also had a few hard pieces (shell?) in the snails, too.  That was a first for me.  The oysters rockafeller were pretty good but rich.  I recommend just sharing a half a dozen with someone else...not choke down the dozen hubby and I did.    Finally, the salad. There was nary a sight of seafood on this thing but it was one of the top two dishes we ordered that night. Everything was fresh and the abundance of cheese made it amazing. I felt bad having mocked hubby for ordering this.  I take it back!  Anyway, we're sure to return on our next trip to spring training.  I'm in love!

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oysters Rockefeller
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chef&#39;s Salad
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Snails

SD1QofevNAUJx8_Vuns2GA.text: We came here on a Monday night at around 6:30pm and got seated right away. This restaurant is a couple blocks from the ASU campus so there's a good chance you'll see a lot of students here or in the area. There's a parking lot right in front of the restaurant.  We came here mainly for their oysters because we'd heard a lot about this place and wanted to try them out. There's mostly outdoor seating; I don't know if there's indoor seating. You might want to bring a light jacket just in case it's a little chilly when you go. This place is dog friendly which is awesome! We saw a lot of furry friends walking around and hanging out.  They have $2 off select appetizers during their happy hour but no other specials for other dishes. The prices below are non-happy hour prices.  OYSTERS (half dozen $9; full dozen $14) - The oysters were not bad. They were not as meaty as I'd hoped, but they were pretty good. 4/5  CASEY'S CHICKEN WINGS ($10) - They have different flavor options: chipotle, BBQ, teriyaki, and Buffalo style. We ordered the chipotle which was good. 4/5  ESCARGOT ($10) - The escargot themselves were okay, but I really liked the mushroom sauce that it came with. It was especially delicious soaking the bread in it. 3/5  Another interesting find is the men's restroom is essentially an open waterfall/pool. There's not much privacy so if you're not into that, you might want to use the restroom before coming here or holding it in until after.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Casey&#39;s chicken wings ($10; $8 during happy hour)

xFm-kgpHACjh5ZCIKelnsQ.text: I was pumped to try this place out on St Patty's day given that it is an Irish Pub, so what better place to guzzle green beer? Oh, how disappointed I was. This is not a real Irish Pub for St Patrick's Day. Not one Irish bartender, like the ones I've been to in NYC.!It is a place where hipsters and drunk college kids congregate.   Ordered shucked oysters-probably the worst I've ever had... EVER. There were seashell bits in in every bite. I had to pick fragments of it from my mouth in between a squishy, dead sea creature. Kind of takes the pleasure out of oyster slurping.   Fried mushrooms were just slimy mushrooms in the center of a deep fried breading, zero flavor served with watered down ranch.   The burger my husband ordered was tasteless and pink on the inside. He loves burgers, I don't think I've ever seen him stop halfway and not finish eating a burger, but I guess there's a first for everything.   I ordered fish and chips, which was the only decent thing. Granted I had to add salt and pepper to my entire plate to give it flavor, as it was bland. It came with coleslaw, which was a joke. Took one bite and said nah.   This place gets 5 stars for service. Our server and the hostess were incredibly attentive and sweet, even on a crazy holiday with rambunctious patrons. If I ever go back, it'd be for the cheap beer, but not the food.

Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Green beer... Can&#39;t mess this up
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oysters, the worst ever... Had seashell bits in every bite

bRvSstpeqi2OXKK_IMK68A.text: No complaints here food came out in timely manner by food runner... server was kind and attentive. everything was nice and hot !!   I will note when you walk in you seat yourself no one greets you which is fine for this restaurants environment  I would come back!!

W7PbqMjCPwIIUzITW1anVQ.text: I just love Caseys. Been a home bar since I was young. The best place to get oysters on the half shell and oyster Rockefeller in all of Phoenix if you ask me. They have some of the best onion soup I have ever had. The kitchen will not disappoint. It's also a great spot to have a Guinness on draft or try a new beer as the selection inside is plentiful. If you want to enjoy dinner with the family, no problem as they have a restaurant in addition to the indoor and outside bar. They also have a great happy hour and if you have a late night craving, the kitchen is open until 1am. Most of the staff have been there from 12 to 20 years and so each time I go there it's like home.

l_pE1D54UtNXXJ_4I_5gfw.text: I really love this place last night was my third time. It's haunted so what's not to like? I recommend the turkey club because it's on a crescent. Get it with potato salad because it's amazing. And my favorite thing is the potato skins I have never had it better any where. Lot of potato but trust me it's worth it. I had one server twice and a sweet server with an accent last night. Both of them where incredible. I don't expect 5 star service in a bar but you can as Casey Moore's I guess there are a lot of reasons why this place has been around all these years.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dog friendly they even brought her a bowl of water

xSYwIjMrPHeEdPI-9dfuCg.text: My purse was stolen from my car through breaking the window. There were several other cars broken into. Apparently this happens often and Casey Moore's had like one camera that was dangling and not angled towards the parking lot so it didn't show anything. I don't understand why they have their own parking lot with no security. I'm never going here again and I don't recommend this place. If your car gets broken into, you're just out of luck. This place sucks.

elXrYOt-4FIp43G1UvZcyw.text: Happy Hour: Monday-Friday 3pm-7pm; Sunday-Thursday 10pm-1am; Saturday-Sunday 11am-4pm HH Specials: $2 off apps (including oysters)  We came on a Monday night and I was surprised to see this place was decently packed. We ordered a dozen oysters, escargot, and chipotle wings. Most of the drinks consisted of beer which wasn't my thing but they did give me a sample of their cider.   For me, the oysters were good considering we were in a dessert area as opposed to sitting seaside. The escargot sauce was delicious but the snails themselves were not. The chipotle wings had a mild kick to them however they were on the smaller side.   All in all, it was a good place to go if you're looking for a place to hang out with friends with cheap food and beer.

54oL7TLk5ADOq6SEc6hRGw.text: Always enjoy Casey's for a pint, and good ambience.  You can get everything from oysters to a vegetarian burger, and everything in between.  Service is always good, and food comes out pretty quick.   I enjoy that you can bring your four legged friends there too.  And that they have water bowls for them.  I love the outdoor seating, and grabbing a spot by the fountain is my idea of perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Favorite spot to chill

5_tXpDpEkOmjWwdGQgIWGQ.text: The Rockafeller oysters are delicious for $18. Baked with cheese spinach and other yummy ingredients. We also ordered a dozen of the raw oysters for $14.  A bite on the pricey end, but the oysters tasted "fresh" for Arizona. I also tried the pineapple cider, which I liked. I recommend it if you like cider.   I've only been here a couple of times. Great spot for a date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fresh dozen oyster
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rockefeller oyster

sUsR4MfOjEkdMqYgAsds2g.text: Forgot I came here in 2014.  Look..this is a college bar and hangout so probably good for that, but not if you want quality raw bar.  Oysters were small and not very well shucked, half the oyster was stuck in the shell, fish and chips were dry and heavy, not light at all, even on the second try.  Not the worse food, but not sure worth all the accolades on here.  However, wait staff was super friendly and they took really great care of us.  So again, if I was ASU, I would totally hang here...but I am not, so I will continue to go to Pappadeaux's for my raw bar.

sSLc86BZYZDdiiEUu-4U2w.text: Have been coming to this Tempe Institution since 1990. It has gone through lots of changes ownership and unfortunately Gavin left about 4 years ago. But the bar and restaurant are still a great place to go for food and drinks. They have an awesome outdoor patio and seating all around. The food is always excellent cooked-to-order and correctly. Plus a very good value and quality. Big portions with a small price tag. If you've never been you definitely need to go and check out Casey Moore's.

D2Dijuv8vYWlsxuCjKefHg.text: I went there for the oysters and I could see this was definitely more a pub than an oyster house. I dont drink, and the oysters were huge and a good price but the place was just way too busy and rowdy for me to enjoy my oysters. Took me a long time to get what I ordered, and the only seating was at the bar so it was not comfortable for me at all and had someone bothering me the whole time. I'll have to come back on a slow day, where I can enjoy my slimy snack in solitude at a table without the ton of rowdy drunk people overwhelming the place. If I do and it's better, I'll edit the review accordingly.

Zi5PyZI5F9OJfyGGDNK0Xg.text: I ran across a note from 2 years ago about a great Irish Oyster Pub in Tempe. As we pulled in the parking lot, we worried about finding a spot but there's plenty of parking! We went inside for lunch instead of the patio, & first off my husband saw the dart board! He definitely enjoys the darts! Then we ordered two beers & discussed the great little pub we didn't know about for years! What a charming, warm & unique place to enjoy a few hours! The food was served quickly, & we enjoyed the oysters, beers, soup, etc very much! It is on our radar now as a great place to go for a delicious meal & a pleasant time!!

redZ6PwKtE0Tdcy9RLoBew.text: Love this place! Cool atmosphere, great outside patio, and fabulous food!

VtztjbiTtGSysWxq74vmyQ.text: Great bar scene! Foods decent but the atmosphere, people, and beer make up for that.  This place has a great personality and is a great place to meet up with some friends.  Very laid-back feeling, almost like your hanging out at your friends patio.

i-dJf3jjVBQiXyorlUpGdg.text: Live near campus? Don't have a back yard? Like to drink? Than Casey Moores might be right for you.   The patio is the main attraction for me. It is like the back yard that I want but am too lazy and cheap to have.   A fire tables, pic nick tables, coy pod with waterfall, outdoor bar and the most unique men's bathroom anyway, more on that later.   As the name would imply there is a Irish theme, and they do have oysters in addition to other standard bar food fare. The food is nothing to brag about.   There is a decent parking lot however this place is popular and you may need to find a spot on a near by block. note go 1 block south to avoid being ticked as the restrictions change.   The outdoor men's bathroom known as the "blarney stone" is great. There is a motion activated waterfall, just unzip your full and donate your beer back to the bar in the most zen fashion available.

GtD9I55sBg9C-SCvmRgzcg.text: Its haunted! Isn't that enough to get everyone to go check out Casey Moore's?  Who doesn't like Casper?!  Such a great compromise... you are still right around Mill Ave and if you are an ASU student this is quite convenient.  However, Casey's is not part of the typical 'Mill Ave' meat-market scene.  Always is a whole slew of people from old timers, to angstful hipster, to stoic gothic, to average joe.    Drinks are reasonably price with a great late night happy hour.  Food is fantastic... the oysters really live up to the name 'Casey Moore's Oyster House'... besides they are supposed to be an aphrodisiac so bring your dates ;)    Lots of outdoor seating (picnic benches) so you can cram people at tables.  The interior is as divey as you are going to get in Tempe ... so I'll take it.   Only downside is unreliable service.. its been quite hit or miss as far as the bartenders go... but the bouncers/ID checkers are undoubtedly hilarious everytime!

yVccoC_EDgriiqwHS49KzQ.text: Yes!  I love neighborhood bars!  A very "you're like family when you come here" kind of place.  I'm here at least once a week.  Between the cheap drinks, great food, christmas lights strung all around the whole outside patio area, the nice and extremely generous bartenders, the very friendly Casey Moore's cats who just walk around and people watch, or just the awesome memories I've had there...this place has all of the ingredients for a good time!

zuNd3km9X56kD2hbEedQDg.text: Literally the worst place I have ever eaten in my entire life.  I didn't know that a restaurant could serve dog meat in America. I would not wish this hole on an enemy. At least the kids linguine soaked in vegetable oil will shoot through them quickly. For me and Lauri we had to lick trash out of a dumpster to get the taste out of our mouth. On the bright side our waitress only visited our table three times. Who in their right mind rated this dump four stars?  Awful.

MJ0Kj6I2bvTENLw9uEhqLA.text: A True Tempe gem.  One of the few old businesses that the City of Tempe hasn't run out of town.  Full of character in a people-that-drink-here-are-either-poets-and/or-criminals way.  Quality bar.  Huge Patio!  Old bar indoors, very divey.  Indoor dining/bar = two story house.  Upstairs dining is a trip, funky wallpaper.  Place is haunted?  Who cares?  Not me.  Great food, especially for dinner.  Service is lack-luster, but adequate.  Excellent beer and booze selection.  Attitudes, tattoos and haircuts galore, but in a good way.  I'd ramble on, but you can read the other reviews to hear more,  especially if you're in the mood for some wimpy nerds to complain about how they had their IDs scrutinized, or it was so packed they had to stand.  Casey's is one of the best spots in town to get lunch and a beer, or just a beer, and sit on the patio when the weather is nice.  Bring some friends, have fun.

qiBi-ITx6MJf82MmzV2PNA.text: Amazing happy hour. go on Wednesdays and Thursdays 4 o'clock to 8 o'clock.outside bar has fans and ac. sun inside bar is laid back and great specials

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States

dG3aw8ZqtdxaP90FnFGsxQ.text: This was one my favorite places to go when I was living in AZ. I absolutely dreaded going to bars like El Hefi or Moonshine, I have always enjoyed a more laid back bar scene. Casey's has a massive outdoor patio with enough space for you to grab drinks with your friends and not EDM blasted into your ear.

9BFuEaS1tqCGeInr8gNpxA.text: Oysters and Shrimp Cocktail are the best I've had in AZ. Great hangout place in the spring and fall.

asV4WUtMraLfJTZsPeEV2g.text: Saturday 12:30 a.m. You'll find cool, hip, modern-urban people here trying to have a good time, for the most part.  You'll have to walk in, through and around the crowds to find your niche conversation with authentic, real minds ready to have an open talk with you.  It takes a few moments to filter through the fake characters that are just there to be furniture in the scenery.   Topics on music festivals, your area of study, occupations, place of origin, vacation spots, existentialism, viewpoints on abortion, immigration, drug policy, healthcare and student loans all ran the gambit of speech. Each person giving their opinion, respectfully, for logical scrutiny, which is all fine and dandy for a prospering democracy.  The bartenders in the outside bar were a bit half-ass, trying to pose for the camera, figuratively speaking of course, so I didn't bother tipping them, since I'm use to Austin bartenders who hustle to get you your drink to earn that tip.    For Phoenix ,it seems like one of the top places to drink, potentially, with progressive, liberal, art-minded people.

jjn2SoLyqXUJa2tLZpE29w.text: I like the large patio but the seats and tables are really small on the patio. The food was really salty. We ordered the calamari and crab bites but couldn't eat them after a while.  The waitress was pretty prompt. The restrooms are really small and hard to find. Only thing I thought was nice was the wrap around outdoor seating. Parking really is a pain.

tpDeNh7UgY7wjPe07UTyQQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE! Moved to Phoenix from Seattle for school and this was the only place I felt I could really kick back and relax. Reminded me of a few of my favorite spots back home on The Hill.  Pros:  -Yummy Seafood selection.  -Plenty of choices for people of all food preferences- meat lovers, pescatarians, vegans, etc. I'd recommend the Caim Chowder, the Hippie Sandwich (YUM!), and the Hummus platter is a great share along with the Calamari. In Arizona good quality Calamari has proved to be hard to come by, but not here!  - My favorite characteristic about this place is the resident kitty that you can find lounging around no matter the size of the crowd :)  - One of the most diverse crowds of people i've seen at one place in Arizona.  - Friendly people and staff; if ever a busy night people will gladly share a table with you. Always made a new friend :)  Cons:  -Staff can be a bit impatient with placing orders and at times I've had to go up to the bar from my table to order drinks because the waiter didn't come by and check up for over 20mins...  Other than that, its a great place to go if you want to meet some kick ass people and avoid the drama of mill and sky rocket prices of old town.

E8VyQuS4aNUCnSkvO16OIA.text: I love coming here when it isn't busy, LOVE it. Problem is, it's busy a lot. I really enjoy the outside atmosphere sitting around drinking and laughing, but when it gets crowded and loud, it turns into an annoyance.    Casey Moore's is a Tempe staple and I hope it's here forever, but bro fights and jock bouncers are unavoidable when you're so close to ASU. I like it here way more than my other half, so Caseys is not a date night place for me, you won't be impressing a lot of girls here, but the food is decent, especially the ever popular fish and chips, but this is more of place to drink and people watch. Come at a good time and you may be blown away, come at a bad time and you may turn right around.

p-dX8So80qrNLJvxtiQ0DQ.text: Casey Moore, a hidden gem in down town Tempe Az area. I've been going here for about 6 years and still keep coming. Food is always good and always seems to have a nice group of people.

mFzjsAvoNpuW7Hdynzdj1g.text: Wow been going there for years but went there recently and was really disappointed, food was horrible, the urinal rock wall was overflowing and leaking all over my shoes and to top it off I sat in a bar stool for 30 minutes before some big shot drug dealer they like there arrived and told me I was in his seat, when I refused to move the bouncers asked me to move. Casey's FAIL

K1hflhL-JTsxy1reHjn7Uw.text: Great place to hang out after class/work, grab some grub, and have a drink.  Expect a lot of hipsters, smoke, and some dogs and cats.  Overall a unique atmosphere for the laid back folk and like to feel relaxed and right at home.

s0-Mvh_Z0UTfeSWb4em1vg.text: If you want to be surrounded by young kids getting their kicks... be my guest... used to be a cool place and is no longer... I give it 2 stars because the bartenders are fast but have no personality whatsoever and and there is no ambiance at all to this place anymore... Plus the fact that they violate Arizona smoking law by allowing people to smoke within 20 feet of the entrances, INFACT lastnight there was someone smoking INSIDE the side door!!   ALL I CAN SAY IS... DISSAPPOIONTED... NEVER AGAIN!!!

8pjmK1Y-3sJUcL1x7LG24g.text: Although I don't normally go to Mill Ave because it's not my scene I DO however enjoy the crap out of Casey's. The food is amazing and the bars are easy to get to and there isn't much of a wait.   To sit down and eat is a whole other experience. I have eaten in the private room upstairs and in the normal dining area and both are treats. The Bloody Mary they have is made with beef bouillon and may be the best one I've ever had. The fish is fresh and everything is clear to me that it is made with care and passion.   I love that it is kind of tucked away from the Mill walkers so it has a more intimate feel for people like me who go there quite.   If you haven't been here you need to.

SLJkgRmP3JyAIzsavoQypQ.text: Basically... This is the only place I want to come and drink with my friends if we're in Tempe. The location is tucked away in a neighborhood and service is always really fast.  I love getting the oyster shooters, I think they're $8 a pop? But they're huge and fun to do with friends. I also like that they have some great beers on draft and lots of seating indoors and outside.   My guy friends rave about coming here for the outdoor bathroom. Which I think is hilarious. Definitely a fun sort of dive bar (but triple the size) in Tempe.

mlMJuz0Et5IS379ggzyjKQ.text: My boyfriend and I visited here last night for the first time -we're both from IL.  We both enjoyed ourselves so much! Staff was very friendly and the food we took home as a carry out was great! We had drinks at the bar while waiting for our order and let me tell ya ,, the Long Island ice tea was strong like its supposed to be! I'm so tired of getting the watered down version I usually get at most places.  We especially liked the outdoor setup with the heaters .. Too bad it was too chilly to sit outside but it looked really nice with the lights and everything.  I hope to come back before returning to IL next month.

SW3U1cTN2pHThhEfucdHlA.text: They had me at haunted!! I loved places with history and this place has just that. Though no ghost sightings for me..the staff were all very attentive and friendly, quick to fill up on drinks and order food. Good music, nice decor, cool crowd. The outside patio area had a life unto its own. Would go there again when back in town.

cp-_cVTu6PhgpvO4aaT_Fw.text: A great place to come to worth friends. Very good atmosphere and delicious food. The staff is always friendly and it is an over all very chill place.

rLInyHOLDF1MRrENH1Q-2w.text: This is a fun place to hang out with a group of friends and catch up! Unfortunately I am not a big fan of their seafood but I am a big fan of their patio and people watching. My hubby and I come here to grab some drinks after work and enjoy the scenery.

O15bs7IuIUWTQVteooXmpQ.text: This was my first time here thought my girlfriend and I would try something new and local. I loved the atmosphere and the story behind the pub. I would suggest this pub if you want to go get just a beer. The food was average. My girlfriend got a shrimp salad and the olives looked canned lack of taste. I got the fried oysters and I wish they would have tasted more fresh. The price of the bill of the bill was steep for our meal. Also, it's a self serve place which is cool but we sat around for almost 15 minutes until someone asked us for drinks. Serves and quality could be improved.

dAaYcM0Yns0c9EgQGGf3aA.text: Hmmm I have some mixed feelings about Casey Moore's. The place is always packed so it's definitely a popular spot. I used to come here all the time back in the college days. This time I came here on a busy weekend night around 8 pm for dinner and drinks. There isn't really a system for getting any kind of table so you have to fend for yourself. We were able to get a spot but waiting for a waitress to come took a while. Like I said it was busy but maybe they just need more staff or something. Once we had our server everything was great! We (ok maybe just I) ordered way too much food. I got the scampi shrimp boat, a dozen oysters, and escargot. You get a ton of escargot, not just the six that you normally get in the dish. The size of the shrimp boat was generous as well. Everything was perfectly cooked and the garlic bread was awesome for dipping in the extra garlic butter. The oysters were just ok. I feel like a place that has oyster in the name should have an actual selection of different oysters and they should be served detached from the shell. They didn't have a ton of flavor either so that was a bummer. We ordered oyster shooters as well which was a huge mistake. I don't know what I was expecting but the giant oyster, mix of tomato (?) juice, and the world's cheapest vodka was not pleasant at all.   Casey Moore's definitely caters to the college drinking crowd, especially on the weekends. So I would recommend if you're coming in for dinner to do it on a quieter night where there's hopefully a bit more organization. Also, if you have an aversion to cigarette smoke the patio is not for you. Everyone around us was smoking it makes for an unpleasant dining environment.

JD5WXLFRqx0aJT4DUX3dlQ.text: A casual place to eat and drink in Tempe.  Lots of outdoor seating and is a great place to come with a group of peeps to eat, drink and be merry.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. A dozen chicken wings for $8. The wings are big.
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. A dozen fresh oysters for $13.  Good for Arizona.

UulF8dwi4N9ILE-NrZZ4mg.text: It's rare for me to rate a place with a five, but this place is exactly what is it. Every year, we come to Az for spring training and we try to find a spot to try for the first time. So far none of them lives up to my expectations. This place.... Is a different story.   This place wasn't far from our hotel when I looked up restaurants on yelp, and as soon as we drove up, I saw the hanging lights and from then, I already knew I was gonna like it inside.   As we approached the entrance, there was a security guard checking ID's, so I'm guessing it's not kid friendly, which is fine. As we walked inside, I immediately had good vibes with the atmosphere there. Loved the "backyard" type feel with the twinkle lighting hanging from really nice tarps, but yet not fully covered so we can still see the stars in the sky, and had lights all over. Tables were like oversized wooden picnic booths like you were in your backyard.   Food wise, well everything we had ordered was amazingly delicious. Started with a dozen of fresh oysters for $13 which was AMAZING. They were the perfect size, came with plenty of lemon, horseradish, cocktail sauce and crackers. Oysters were again amazing, I still can't stop thinking about how yummy they were.   Ordered fried pickle spears with Ranch for $6. AMAZING. The pickles were super juicy and the batter was perfect. I know I keep Saying "amazing" but me when I say it's amazing, it's because they really are.   Hubby ordered build your own burger, came with the works, added cheese, sauteed mushrooms which by the way were sooooo flavorful and mouthwatering, the beef patty was perfectly cooked to his ordering and again flavorful, also came with yummy loaded fries.   Too bad we were full because otherwise, since all the item we ordered were all so yummy, we couldn't wait to try the others. This place is by far our favorite spot to go to even after years of trying out other places from Az. If you're reading this and you don't try this place. I'm telling you right now. YOU ARE MISSING OUT ON SOME GOOD ASS FOOD.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. The view from where I was sitting enjoying a dozen of fresh oysters!

pEILBCM6EAtO_6TUiF6iMQ.text: I haven't had their oysters yet but I'm sure they're amazing. The atmosphere and the service is what makes this place so great! The patio that is honestly most of the restaurant is seriously beautiful with all the trees and twinkly lights overhead. They have a pretty good beer selection and make some seriously killer old fashions.

j7AxV3qs8dfwmdK0rwi-EQ.text: Okay, I can't give it five stars, because it's definitely not perfect, but this is a solid restaurant that I eat at all the time.  Went in on "black Friday" and it was a nice respite from the shopping. We found a place to sit down, and even though my wife picked a table far away from the service station, Alyssa (sorry if the spelling is wrong) greeted us quickly and was super-sweet.  The steamed clams took longer than expected- we probably waited 30 minutes for something that cooks in 3 minutes- but still, they were tender and tasty. Garlic bread is fantastic in this place.  Also had the "shrimp boat" with spicy cajun sauce. Honestly, it was killer. I will definitely order that again. Just the right amount of "hot."  This place really focuses on beer. If I were twenty years younger and could still drink beer, I would be at this place all the time- five stars. If they put as much focus on the kitchen as they did the beer selection, the restaurant would be better.  Service and beer are their best qualities though. Stay for the food, while you are sitting there.

pwf_ocQKkxtKd5RkqY-s2A.text: Great happy hour, great food. Love the outdoor seating. One of my favorite places in Tempe.

8AZyI6X_RWgJDoRRP5osFg.text: This place was not bad. I went once and was happy I did, but I don't think I will be going back. It was a long walk from the hotel for something that was ok.

8r-XO4skIO31cw-ulAqeFw.text: Love this place. It's open late and the vibe is fun. We love the oysters here especially during reverse happy hour. The escargot is great and their wings are delicious! The calamari was disappointed, it's like super battered and like the frozen kind. The fried mushrooms are also heavily battered. I didn't like their fried stuff except the fish and chips are great. I had the clam chowder and it was good too. Guinness is on tap! Yum! Definitely will come back for great drinks and food.

k3tQUtgVGRi-yar20JjAjg.text: Nice place to meet up with friends. Don't forget your card overnight though. Apparently, they take the liberty of tipping themselves instead of the cardholder directly. It's no surprise though if you understand the type of people who work the bar there.

Q1xViaFst_YChbeL4H0LiQ.text: The food is good here...but they really need to improve the outside seating area. Fans didn't work which seemed to create a huge annoyance with flies...no candles to detour flies...come on...with a small investment, the outside seating and be more enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oysters are good!

kJqmpQ6EdWMB06zLeo2qhg.text: Love the wings. Excellent price for what you get.   The service was horrific. The waiter was more focused on people who ordered alcohol when my friend and I bought food and an appetizer, it's not like we were at the bar top. Takes forever for refills. We split checks and instead of printing a check for my friend and I separately he stood there for three minutes trying to split and do the math in his head. Btw my friend was charged $3 for a soda, so at that point you might as well order something with alcohol in it. We both give him our cards after this long period of mental math he did you would think he would swipe the cards right plus one is chase blue and the other was black. Well he split the checks and swiped my card for both checks.  The checks just listed the amount on them so there is no proof of what my friend or I ordered.   Honestly if the wings weren't so good I wouldn't go back. I still plan to go but if I see this waiter I will more than confidently walk out and eat somewhere else.

js8i5FFW7A7EgBBzFtPVug.text: Love the food and the beer selection, but what I really enjoy is the backyard-esque atmosphere.  Casey's is mostly outdoor patio with a small indoor area with a bar and some tables and (of course) restrooms. Much of the patio is shaded and they turn on the water misters in the summer to help cool things down.  In the winter when it gets chilly, they have plenty of heat lamps to warm it up a bit.  When they get busy on weekend nights, you may be searching for a table for a while and you may not get your drinks/food as quickly as you would like.  Be patient!  It is worth the wait.    Bathrooms are clean and well kept, as is everything else.  You will not see leftover plates of food laying around on tables or trash on the floor/ground.  Everyone does a really great job of keeping things tidy.    Four stars because I think they could hire a couple more servers for busy times so that no one is overwhelmed with too many tables.  Other than that, this is my regular watering hole and will continue to be as long as I'm living in the Phoenix area!

eEJnG0I8jbVZtsid94Kw1A.text: Don't let the appearance of this laid paid establishment turn you away! The service was impeccable, and the food was delish! We googled restaurants with couches as I wanted a laid back atmosphere for the evening. I ordered grilled shrimp with rice -veggies, my husband ordered fajitas and of course oysters on the half shell as an appetizer  (awesome) . There was an eclectic group of people here which made the night interesting. We will be back and highly recommend Casey Moore's Oyster House!

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Our favorite hang out place

TicXIJu8drFRQb2TGe2Ngw.text: Stopped for for a quick appetizer and didn't want to lease.   The shrimp, oysters and fried pickles were amazing. I loved the relaxed atmosphere, wish I could have stayed all day.

fY97KiK-IFLLPf-J1HetBg.text: I've been to Casey Moore's a few times. It is a nice option for lunch or dinner.   There is seating inside and outside. Because the restaurant is an old house, the environment gives a rustic, homely feel inside and a patio feel outside. People also say the restaurant is haunted. I believe you can request to dine in the room where the ghost supposedly are.  The food. My favorite thing to get for lunch is the hamburger or the blackened salmon.  This time I got the salmon. For happy hour, my go-to is the wings. YUM!  Service is as expected but better after work. I'm sure it has to do with the manpower as I've seen the servers work a wide floor during lunch.   I definitely recommend going, if just for the vibes!

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Blackened salmon

0iWdFRnwmn3xhgVLWd4iuQ.text: Casey Moore's Oyster House is an old style bar, with low ceilings, dark lighting, that serves up some wonderful bar grub, all in a former private house.   What Casey Moore isn't, is a stale beer smelling dive. The oysters here were delicious, the shrimp was fresh and tasty, and the steak was well cooked and exceptional.   What more would you want?  Oh, a great bar and great beer on tap.  Check and check. The proof, try coming here on a Friday night. Yeah it's near ASU, but it's packed with non-student locals.  Casey Moore's is a Tempe Arizona original.   Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Whiskey Menu
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bar Menu
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beer Menu

9RmNmoBLOGX7w6uZJPCL-A.text: First things first.  I've been here dozens of times.  It's my favorite place for oysters in The Valley.  Guiness was the daily special on this particular day.  It was acceptable.  Unfortunately all pasterized Guiness served in America pales when compared to drinking the real unaltered deal in Ireland.  This was no exception.  The oysters were basically on point.  Fresh, briny, meaty, and delicious. A lot of shells this time.  I do not understand why their shuckers cannot not go the extra step to sever the abductor muscle before serving.  Even my bartender said "You took your time eating those", as she noticed I struggled with a small cocktail fork to loosen the morsel.  Side note:  their horseradish is the hottest and best I've even had.  I've had gallons of clam chowder in the Northeast in my life.  This clam chowder was totally disappointing.  Floury, floury, floury, with little cream.   Really good chunks of clam though.  But not something I will order in the future.  Good, but not quite up to the standard I normally expect from Casey's.  I'll be back.

0pEewkREj2frYqPnHjc_kw.text: I used to go here back in my 20's, never knew the history. My eldest is into ghost stories, so I did some research in our area. This haunted spot was a perfect place to go. If you don't know the restaurant ghostly history, look it up, then visit.  The atmosphere is charming and laid back, and the food is fabulous. The outdoor patio is huge, and there are plenty of places to sit inside, each area with its own personality. Favorite dish (and healthy), was the Hippy Sandwich. The appetizers were all delicious, and happy hour gives $2 discount on each.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Inside bar.  At Casey Moore&#39;s in Tempe, AZ.
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Stained glass throughout.  At Casey Moore&#39;s in Tempe, AZ.
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. &#39;Dancing&#39; room.  At Casey Moore&#39;s in Tempe, AZ.

KsDdfXm9tPUzdk2q_Ae1wA.text: Went for lunch. Probably a better place to go for dinner.   Has indoor and outdoor seating. Help yourself.    Service is attentive.  Food was good. Oyster is fresh and big.  Garlic bread with clam dish was good.   Mushroom cap escargot was ok.  Good selection of beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States

mpKbg3xAMS1K21bvdorljQ.text: It has Oysters in the name so they better be on point; sadly they were not shucked properly and they were warm. They were also extremely large.   The atmosphere was cool. It had a good vibe. I did not like looking at the poorly maintained Koi pond. Poor fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Me and Katie

7gbFtIz_Jz8S9Yy1fUqmfQ.text: I really enjoy this place, the oysters are always fresh, cocktail sauce is spot on and the service is friendly and efficient. We've only ever sat at the bar but the patio looks like is has a good vibe going on. Still waiting to try their wings which I've heard are pretty good! I'll be back for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States

HEW7pyLYE4sBl1cmIK1QvA.text: Was visiting town and came here on the recommendation of a local. The fried pickles and mushrooms are awesome! Great beer selection, including lots of local brews. Bar is nice a dark.  Staff is very friendly. Good prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Interior bar
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried mushrooms, calamari, and pickles - so good!
Photo of Casey Moore's Oyster House - Tempe, AZ, United States. The sign

sl-jGqT9U9BYQW-wXGDtGQ.text: If you are looking for a hideaway or a local Tempe restaurant this is the place. I have had the oysters (very good). CalamariRings are also very good.  Fish and chips are fantastic as well but the shrimp and Alvarado salad is the best!    This hideaway is in an old house and have a huge patio with two bars with full staff.  Most of the staff has been there 5-20 years and are amazing.    Try it out - you won't be disappointed.

YHQlC7v5Z9Y-3IlI4yfSjg.text: This place is a gem! The inside is so fun and different. The staff was super friendly and welcoming.
